info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:22PM CDT until July 03 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ETOWAH AND SOUTHERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 422 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Eastern Weiss Lake to near Glencoe, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hokes Bluff, Centre, Cedar Bluff, Centre Municipal Airport, Glencoe, Gaylesville, Tennala, Ballplay, Cornwall Furnace Park, Western Weiss Lake, Eastern Weiss Lake, Moshat, Ball Flat, Coloma, Fullerton, Howells Crossroads, Reaves and Waterhouse. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
